summary: This is an email chain from June 22, 2009, forwarding a June 19, 2009 letter and exhibits from Jeffrey Epstein's attorney Jay Lefkowitz to an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of Florida. The email discusses the receipt of a 3-ring binder containing legal response documents, including a 135-page exhibit attachment.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Attorney from Kirkland & Ellis LLP who sent a letter and exhibits responding to the U.S. Attorney's Office on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the legal correspondence; his attorney is responding to the U.S. Attorney's Office on his behalf.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is acting as Epstein's defense attorney, sending legal response letters and exhibits to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Legal Response Submission
events.description: Jay Lefkowitz sends letters and exhibits responding to recent letters from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Receipt of Legal Binder
events.description: A 3-ring binder containing the June 19 response documents is received in West Palm Beach (WPB) and forwarded via email.

locations: 500 East Broward Boulevard, Ft. Lauderdale, FL 33394
keyFacts: On June 19, 2009, defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz sent a formal legal response with exhibits to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The response included a 135-page exhibit attachment, indicating substantial documentation was being submitted.
The correspondence was handled by Kirkland & Ellis LLP, a major law firm representing Epstein.
The documents were physically sent in a 3-ring binder via FedEx to West Palm Beach, showing formal legal proceedings were ongoing.
